intro: Megalastrum mollicomum, commonly known as the soft-leaved starflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family, which includes other familiar plants like willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and yellow. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to retain moisture in its arid environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
